intro: Lithocardium gerascanthodes var. puberulum, commonly known as the hairy lithocardium, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in areas with low rainfall. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of pink or red, and it blooms during the warmer months. Due to its limited habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
